main_definition: to have a desire or expectation that something will happen or be the case in the future.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To wish for or want something to happen. For example, 'I hoped it would rain today so we could go swimming.'
meanings_and_examples.example: 'He hoped his team would win the game.'

meanings_and_examples.definition: To anticipate a certain outcome and have optimism about it. For example, 'She hoped that her hard work would pay off in terms of promotions at her job.'
meanings_and_examples.example: 'They hoped their efforts to reduce pollution would be effective by next year.'

meanings_and_examples.definition: To express a preference or inclination towards something. For example, 'He hoped for the best but prepared for the worst in his plans.'
meanings_and_examples.example: 'After her surgery, she hoped to recover quickly and return to work.'
